course_title: Foundation Studio: Ideas as Practice I

001.comments: VISA 183 001 and all studio sections will be delivered 100% online, with some synchronous (i.e., "real time") and some asynchronous components. Please register in one of the associated studio sections. If the section is blocked, this class is full and waitlist VISA 183 01W has been opened. Students will be moved from the waitlist into the course as seats become avaliable, and then notified of their registration via email.

L01.comments: This tutorial section is taken in conjunction with VISA 183 001. To register in a studio section you must first be registered in the lecture.

L02.comments: This tutorial section is taken in conjunction with VISA 183 001. To register in a studio section you must first be registered in the lecture.

L03.comments: This tutorial section is taken in conjunction with VISA 183 001. To register in a studio section you must first be registered in the lecture.

L08.comments: This tutorial section is taken in conjunction with VISA 183 001. To register in a studio section you must first be registered in the lecture.

002.comments: Please also register in one of the associated studio sections. If the section is blocked, this class is full and waitlist VISA 183 02W has been opened. Students will be moved from the waitlist into the course as seats become avaliable, and then notified of their registration via email.Covering historical, political, theoretical, and practical issues of art and image-making, you will be introduced to the issues inherent in making representation. Painting, mixed media, experimental practices and the role of the medium in creating and receiving images and how that has progressed through history within the boundaries of modern and post-modern tendencies in artistic practice. Focusing on colour, language, collage, and participatory work through strategies of reduction, deconstruction, abstraction and concept. Weekly one-hour lectures will be elaborated in three-hour studio times, applying learned concepts in class discussions, projects and homework; students are expected to show work for group critiques.

01W.comments: VISA 183 01W is a waiting list for VISA 183 001. Students will be moved from the waiting list into the course, space permitting, in order of registration date.While we hope all interested students will obtain a seat in this class, please be aware that being in the waiting list does not guarentee you will obtain a seat in the class.

description: Contemporary art practices, emphasizing the relationship between meanings and materials, art historical contexts and concepts, and non-traditional materials. (This course is open to all UBC students, regardless of prior experience.)
